Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice and clean within budget for all. * afordable*”
Reviews.Author: sahshazia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location is great just outside mall of emeraites ...... Very central not a problem to get A taxi .... Hotel service is very good and efficient check in didn't take long I didn't like the view of my room and reception was happy enough to change it for me. Hotel also had a wheel chair which was very convienant, my dad had decided to travel to Dubai without his and found it quite hard to get about but hotel was great they gave my dad the wheelchair to borrow to go about. The breakfast was nice to be honest alot better than I expected for a 3 star. Rooms size is ok not too small or big just average. Cleaness was very good. Definately I would say overall the hotel was more than I expected great service

Reviews.Title: “Very good considering its a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: MizzTiff
Reviews.Content: Coming from SA, I was not expecting this for a 3 star hotel. The hotel is lovely, clean and right across the road from the Mall of the Emirates. I will admit, breakfast was rarely hot when we got there, lukewarm at best and we still had to pay for it separately, but it was always tasty. I can't say it was "amazing" but I can say, for what you pay, it is well well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “good service for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kiev_UkraineRuslana
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Mall of Emirates and metro station friendly stuff pull area is rather small and always full of people MAXX bar is amazing with realy good live music

Reviews.Title: “Tipical Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: huguesheylen
Reviews.Content: Previuous time I used the Citymax chain was in Sharjah and I was not quite happy. This time I choose the one in the city center of Dubai (near the Emirates Mall). Overall the hotel was full of tourist. The extra services offered by the hotel were then also focused on the tourist activity. Rooms were small but ok but again the bathroom was not that clean and needs urgent refurbishment. There was a good internet line in the room but for wireless you needed to pay extra which is according to me a bad service. There were two bars in the hotel so you could relax and have a drink. The hotel is located just across the Emirate Mall which is very nice. You can spend some time over there. Breakfast was not great, so I would advice to take your breakfast outside the hotel. To summarise, correct basis hotel just to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: meloddica
Reviews.Content: Value for money, clean, excellent location right next to mall of emirates where you can reach metro station easily, staff was friendly and helpful, rooms are sort of small but excellent for a solo traveler, the room had free wired internet and a small seating area, I didn't try the pool as it was cold during my stay but it looked nice. Highly recommended for budget travelers and they won't feel they are getting less than 4 stars service or quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: islandlover39
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel. It is only a short walk to Mall of the Emirates and the attached metro station, hence why we chose it. The overall deciding factor was the price, it's definitely worth it. It's not the fanciest hotel around, but is clean, comfortable and modern. There are a couple of bars and places to eat, which gives you the option to eat in if you don't feel like heading out. The hotel lobby was always full of people suggesting it is a well used hotel, yet it never felt that way once you left the lobby. The only downside was that the lobby always smelt of cigarette smoke. Also the room wasn't the quietest, we could hear doors closing and the people above having a shower. That being said, the levels of noise weren't too bad, I slept undisturbed. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to others and will definitely stay again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Takaidza M
Reviews.Content: One thing that struck me the most was the brilliant location ( very close to the Emirates Mall and the Metro station/buses and taxis). The breakfast is good with a wide selection to pick from. There is gym with limited services plus a small pool on the roof top. The hotel has a live band on Mon till Fridays in one of the bars and there is also a sports bar for those who prefer a laid back environment. The rooms are a bit small though comfortable but there is need to attend to the showers because water easily escapes to the bathrom floor when bathing.The Al barsha is generally quite and less crowded compared to places such as Deira which is also something I loved about the area. The free shuttle service to the beach is also another plus but you have to pay for internet services Overally I would give a thumbs up to the place !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Quaker_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying eight nights at this hotel. The hotel is situated next to the Mall of the Emirates and is a five minute walk from the Metro Station. Although the rooms are quite small they are nevertheless perfectly adequate. Breakfasts are reasonably priced and there is ample choice. Taxis can be caught outside the hotel and are very cheap. Their are also many restaurants in the nearby Mall and they are good quality and not expensive. Sights worth seeing in Dubai include Burj Khalifa, Marina and Souks (take the Dhow across the Creek for one Dirham). I would recommend taking the Dubai Big Bus Tour as it is very good to orientate you with Dubai. The staff at Citymax were all very helpful and I would advise visitors to Dubai looking for good value to stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with free wifi”
Reviews.Author: mpoloAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just few minutes from Mall of Emirates and the Metro. The room is clean but rather small. The twin room have 2 small beds each of about 2 feet across and not suitable for grown up. Thie small size bed is not obvious from the hotel website pictures dispalyed. However, free wifi is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AlinaCteq
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights (13th floor). No hot water on the very first morning. Complaned and they "fixed it", so for the rest of the stay hot water was available from the tap in the sink and from the tap in the shower, but shower itself was still only cold!!! Breakfast choice was very poor. Location however was great, room was clean but a bit noisy. Staff was friendly. They also let us hire beach towels/mats after we checked-out, which normally shouldn't be allowed. Great Falafel takeaway just opposite the hotel, they give you a few to try while you wait for the order.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Torunn787
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days and found Citymax to be a convenient place to stay when the purpose was sightseeing and shopping. The rooms were clean and the staff helpful and friendly. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Two days in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: MAK1966
Reviews.Content: Great location next to emirates Mall, 3 stars but can be easily 4 stars , good out let , friendly staff , big rooms , but the room had a strange odor and I felt that though it was a non smoking room but someone have been smoking there . I highly recommend for short trip to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mina249
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 6 days,stay was pleasant,staff very cooperative,Breakfast served was of good quality. Location is good ,near to the mall of Emirates & metro station.You have to pay for wifi.We got value for our money.The pool & health club is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mutaz08
Reviews.Content: I liked staying in Citymax Barsha,, clean and fancy place. the best quality of service with cheap prices. good location , next to shops restaurants, metro and all you need. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: uk_globecruiser
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was pretty good value for money bearing in mind it is in Dubai. It is the equivalent to a Travelodge (UK). It is clean, comfortable and I walked to the Madinat Jumeirah in just over half an hour. Worth a walk there for shops, bars and restaurarants. It's also only a few minutes walk from the Metro and Mall of the Emirates. Only negative is that the music bar and sports bar are both VERY smoky. So much so that I think only smokers are comfortable going in there! The hotel definitely need to turn up the extraction system or better still make it non-smoking!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, new hotel with great potential and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dany_in_BKK
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Citymax during the peak season in Dubai and the hotel was really full. You could tell by the number of guests waiting in the lobby throughout the day and evening. This is basically a 3-star hotel which is relatively new and located in an increasingly popular and developing area behind the Mall of the Emirates. The rooms are adequately sized and come with the amenities one would expect for the hotel category plus a little more such as free wired internet access, fridge, coffee and tea making facilities in the room. As some earlier previews mentioned, it has a higher standard than Ibis for example, which is usually priced at the same level but feels less than 3-star in comparison. Another goodie is the free underground parking, a blessing if you have a car and to avoid the hot Dubai sun! The only major flaw worth commenting on is the shower design. It is virtually impossible to take a shower without soaking the bathroom floor, no matter what you do. The shower basin is shallow and the cabin itself is half-open with no curtain, so water splashes automatically and flows over the edges. The bathroom in the room I stayed in already showed severe moisture damage to the floor tiles, door frame and corners. This is a pity really because this flawed, non-functional design is bound to run this hotel down very quickly if not rectified soon and is likely to result in high maintenance costs and hence higher rates to maintain the standard. Opening the windows can become a noisy and dusty affair, since Al Barsha is currently undergoing a major construction boom and road works all around the hotel are in progress. As a result, the roads are congested during the day and sand is constantly in the air. This prevented me from switching off the very efficient A/C in the room to enjoy the naturally pleasant January breeze in Dubai. Walking to MoE takes about 7 minutes and reaching the metro station takes another 7-10 minutes inside the mall. Apart from the hotel restaurants which I didn't get the chance to try, there are a couple of good Arabic food joints (falafel, bakery) right opposite and next to the hotel if you want to grab a quick bite.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Angelique_op_Reis.
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Dubai since 2007 and this time we stayed six nights from December 28th until January 3rd in hotel Citymax Al Barsha. We choose this hotel because of its central location close to the Mall of the Emirates. Our flight from Amsterdam to DXB took 6 hours and 30 minutes and we arrived very early in the morning. The check in time in the hotel is officially after 2.00 pm, but after paying 180 AED we immediately got a room. We wonder why they make scans of the passports. It is forbidden in the Netherlands and we didn’t find it necessary because we have booked a packaged deal via a travel agency! Room: We asked for separate beds and were given a twin bedded room on the 11th floor. The room was very basic, but clean. We heard no noise from the streets and it was very quiet. Facilities room: - TV (BBC World, Dubai One and RTV) Unfortunately no CNN World or BVN TV (channel for Dutch expats). - Open closet - Desk with chair - Chair - Coffee/tea maker with two mugs and two glasses - Fridge - Air conditioning Bathroom: - Shower - Four towels - Soap Business Corner: Next to the coffee shop are two computers which we can use through a voucher. This voucher costs AED 20 for 1 hour and is valid for 24 hours, AED 35 for 3 hours or AED 50 for 24 hours. I asked the receptionist if we can print some documents. She said that we had to send these documents to the reception fo@citymax.nl. Why should I send my documents to the reception? A socalled ‘Business Corner’ must have a printer, doesn’t it? Strange! After checking the internet I saw that there was a printer selected, so I asked the receptionist again. Now it was possible to print my documents. The printer was installated at the coffee shop and each print costs 1 AED. Why didn’t she say that before? Breakfast: The buffet is from 6.30 am until 10.30 am and was good. Sometimes it was very crowded so we had to wait a couple of times for a table. The personnel is very friendly and asked every time before closing time if we needed something else from the kitchen. International dinner buffet: The dinner is from 7.00 pm until 11.00pm and costs AED 55. We dined here two times and it was very good. Rooftop pool: The pool is located at the rooftop and is open from 07.00 am to 09.00 pm. From here we have a nice view at the hotel Burj al Arab and the Burj Khalifa. On New Years Eve we had a very nice view of the firework shows from both Burjes. Fire alarm test: On Monday 02nd of January there was a fire alarm test at 11.30 am. We got informed via a letter on Sunday. But, in the evening at 10.30 pm we were roughly woken up by a very loud noise. Was this an alarm? We called the reception, but we got no answer. Unfortunately we couldn’t sleep anymore that evening, while we had to wake up at 03.15 am. Our transfer to the airport was at 04.30 am. Check out: It was just after 04.00 am when we checked out. The receptionist didn’t ask “How was your stay”, only “How can I help you”? We paid the bill and she didn’t give the change money immediately, but covered it with papers while she was working in the computer. I asked her what she was doing all the time and she told me that there was a problem with the system. Okay, but I want my money back. “I gave you the money, she said” “No!” We showed her that she covered our money with papers. Okay, it’s very early in the morning….. After checking out she didn’t say goodbye. That was it. But, we had a great holiday in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to use a base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: TheChennaiFoodie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located fantastically behind the mallof the emirates and is easily accessible by the metro and is pretty close to quite a few attractions and the beach. The hotel is very clean and the staff were polite. They ask for the payment upfront while checking in and I found this to be pretty odd, but I guess there is some policy of some sort. There were no toiletries in the bathroom and the house keeping was pretty ordinary. The front office staff were very helpful for any information that we needed regarding Dubai. But for the price of 222 aed per night, this hotel was a super base for us. We left the room everyday at 10 am and came back at 11 pm by the last metro and for that, it was a great place to come home to after a long day of sightseeing. The bathtub was an added advantage to soak tired legs. If you get a deal for around 200 aed, then this place is worth it, but if you are paying upward of 300, then there are better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: Ayamgoreng
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel for a short break in December 2011. Easy booking via internet, and well placed very near with Mall of Emirates.The staff was very helpful, friendly and efficient. The room is simple, clean and tidy, just perfect for me. They provided free wired internet in the room and also universal power socket for my gadget. The one that I missed was toothbrush and toothpaste... So, bring your own. Room also equipped with tea / coffee making facilities It was very easy to get a taxi from or to this hotel, and for other option you can use Metro via Mall of Emirates Metro Station. And I took a loo

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel..good location”
Reviews.Author: AndA1422
Reviews.Content: We as a couple stayed in Citymax for 5 nights and I must say it was far better then what we were expecting. Rooms are small but clean..(housekeeping cleans it for you everyday) good for people who are visiting Dubai for the first time or are there for sightseeing/business because staying in the room for longer hours can get a little suffocating. Breakfast is okay(Indian and English cuisine) Coffee shop stays open 24 hours. Before going I read a comment on this site about no room service which turned out to be totally false because they have 24 hours room service but you have to pay 200 Dhs in advance for that. The best part about this hotel is its location Mall Of Emirates is across the road, Jumeirah Beach is not too far either. They have the best sports bar in the area if you are into sports it's the place to be at. For couples we would suggest Maxx Bar & Grill has a nice atmosphere(karaoke and live music). Try to get rooms on higher floor preferably facing Burj-ul-Arab. You'll be needing your bathroom utilities 'cos they only provide liquid hand wash. Overall it was a good experience for us, staff is very professional, considering it's a 3 star hotel they are doing a pretty good job.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas week end stay”
Reviews.Author: trojanguy88
Reviews.Content: It was a peak time for visitors and because of its location and very short walk to the mall, it was the be best for us on a budget. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was ok. The Sports bar was good but a bit smokey. If you are a non smoker, the non smoking rooms cannot be guaranteed, so you take your chances on availability when you check in. We were lucky. Otherwise, good place to stay on a budget. TP

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Wassila C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Citymax Al Barsha many times. The location is perfect, it takes only two minutes to reach the Mall of the Emirates by walk and it is very easy to find a taxi from the hotel. The staff was professional and the check-in was quick. The rooms are clean and comfortable, not very big. The only negative points are the noise of the AC (I was on the highest floor so I do not know if all the rooms have the same problem), the ventilation makes too much noise during the night and if you switch it off the room temperature is too hot, if your room is located in the first floor near the pub you can have a lot of noise from the music bar until 1.00 am and some of the room (especially connecting rooms) do not have good sound insulation. This hotel is suitable for business and visit stay (discover Dubai, weekend...)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms..door slamming!!! arghhh! = no sleep”
Reviews.Author: leaharobertson
Reviews.Content: This hotel I stayed at for 4 nights.If you can get it for 200 dirhams a night then your onto a winner...I will say that the rooms are very clean and sufficent..much much better than the IBIS which I have stayed in so many times ive lost count.The Ibis has totally lost its way in terms of price so I decided to try Citymax instead.. The only big downside for me were the amount of Russian prostitutes hanging around the place..Barsha area in Dubai is always full of Russians and this is kind of off putting to be in a hotel and area and have to witness this..but thats I guess most places in Dubai now..I have lived there 10 years so I know! Another big down side to this hotel is the noise level..people constantly slamming their doors shut..It was going on all night with no consideration for other guests..I had to wear earplugs..even this didnt help much.. The first room the hotel put me in was on the 7th floor on the main road(even though id asked for a quiet room) and it was so noisy I had to move the same day..I went to the backside of the hotel..AWAY from the main busy road..do not take a room at the front side and try to get a high floor. Overall if you manage to book this hotel at a super cheap price then its ok..But be prepared for noise in the corridors from door slamming. Internet was free in the rooms however,it was slow and u have to keep re-connecting..which in itself drives u nuts..but any internet better than none I guess.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VIEWS OF DUBIA”
Reviews.Author: bostonron60
Reviews.Content: got taxi from airport to hotel (aprox 20 mins depends on trafic) you start with a 25 uae dollar charge on taxi for being in airport. total charge was 75 uae paid 100 uae and was happy with service (about 20 GBP) plenty of taxis outside hotel for getting back to airport less 25uae dollars on clock as you only pay this comming out of airport it is possible to get the metro train from airport but we preffered taxi .Good location of hotel for the mall of emerates very large shopping center and indoor ski slope this is just across the road aprox 300yd walk which has a very good selection of fast food outlets at across the board prices from very cheap upwards also has large carryfore supper market .Hotel has swimming pool on roof but sun loungers are limited (about 20) with free use of towels and free gym Breakfast in hotel was ok but other meals were not for us paid for these on half board basis but could not face them ate out cheaply at the mall and had nice food.The hotel haves it own bars one for sport television the other a disco 2 pints of beer and a gin and tonic was aprox 90uae (about 16.50GBP) Try and get a room above 7 th floor as it can get noisey from some traffic going by .Hotel staff very helpfull and friendly coffee making facillities in room and free safe If you want to get out and about use the metro this is found by walking straight through the mall and most of the ticket office staff speak english and most signs and directions are explained in english Free courtesy bus to beach but it is first come basis and has to be booked 24hrs prior.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: VeraSvarcova
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good - near shopping center and metro. Our room was small but clean, breakfast acceptable for the price. By check-in we were requested to give them full amount for the room as the guarantee what we did not understand because they had our credit card details for payment. Our reservation was made through booking.com but by check-out they calculated higher price for the room . Beach transfer is very limited - only for a few persons - so any time we asked for this service it was not available during the whole 5 days of our stay. No shuttle from and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a shopping/beach trip”
Reviews.Author: minxtress
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at beginning of October for a weeks break with a girlfriend. Staff couldnt of been more helpful unlike some of the reviews ive read on here. It is ideally located opposite mall of the emirates and a short ride away to the beach....which is either by taxi or the hotels own bus, the bus drops you right beside Burj al arab where the beach is lovely. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and always found something to our tastes on the breakfast buffet and the pool is ideal for a chill out sunbathe after hitting the shops. The rooms were spotless and cleaned regularly. Fridge in the rooms to keep your drinks/suncreams cold so cant complain. We had a room quite high up and heard no noise from road or other guests. I would highly recommend this hotel based on its location and excellent standards. Feel free to contact me if you want to ask anything about it

Reviews.Title: “Well Located but very Unprofessional Attitude of Staff”
Reviews.Author: ramanchugh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located right next to the Mall of Emirates. The hotel is small and primarily a business hotel. On your checkin you get the taste of their inhospitable hospitality. The reception staff asks for a deposit (although you would have paid the entire room rent) else you will not be able to use the room service. When we said we will settle the bills when we use room service they refused on accepting cash. Maybe they don't trust their staff with cash. The saving grace was that every floor has vending machines so you can always but water, aerated drinks and packaged snacks round the clock. The rooms are small but neat. We took a double bed but they only have queen size beds so its not very comfortable. The toilets are also tiny but clean. They have a small roof top pool which is not very big if you are planning to swim for exercise. They do have a small gym at the same floor. They have a sports bar which is always empty & also a bar with live music which is good. However, again the staff is pathetic. It doesn't matter if you are a house guest or not they black guy outside is very rude and needs to leave the hospitality line soon else the owners will suffer big time. I'll be surprised if he hasn't been socked by someone till date. The servers inside the bar also don't seem to understand the concept of hospitality. Once you order they will not leave till you make the payment for the drinks again it doesn't matter if you are a house guest and they know your room no. Pathetic attitude and even if you plan to stay there do give their bars a miss, there are much better and hospitable options outside. In short :- Hotel Location - Good. Rooms - Clean but small. Room comfort - Good air-conditioning but queen size beds. Hotel Staff & management policies - Pathetic. Value for money - Good. Wont get a hotel at the price they offer in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations- Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: greasy
Reviews.Content: A friend booked this hotel for us recently. He had stayed there, the rest of us had not. We knew only that it was in a great location and it was cheap ($200 for a double room for 3 nights), so I personally was not expecting much. However, from arrival, I was very impressed with this hotel. There was a slight booking issue (they had given us rooms with double beds and were completely booked, so we had to wait 2 days to change it), but other than that the service was superb. As the other reviews say, the rooms are small. With two people in the room you have to work it like a puzzle to maneuver around. But, being in Dubai, we weren't expecting to spend much time in the room anyways. The beds were comfortable, the TV worked well, and the AC was cold. Decor was also aesthetically pleasing, contemporary and simple. The bathrooms matched the rooms-also small. The first room we were in had a bathtub that was only partially closed off, so some water got out when taking a shower. The second room was just the little shower basin, so the floor flooded a bit. Easily solved by putting down an extra towel. The Maxx bar was also a surprise. The clientele was diverse, not just hotel guests. There were some obvious regulars (awkwardly comfortable in their domain), and generally just a nice mix. The prices were good, they had some different deals each night. Just don't plan on it being a romantic meal/relaxing night out... the music (live band) was absurdly loud.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmadGharaibeh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice, i have been advised to book in it through my cousin who lives in AUH and always book in that hotel when he is in Dubai. the service is great, rooms are small, but decent, very clean, with a very comfy bed, and LCD, fridge, safe, and complimentary tea and coffee offered, bathroom is clean, which is the most important. the hotel is facing the back side of the mall of emirates, great location, you can walk through the mall, follow the signs, and you will reach the metro station. for the people coming with their cars, the hotel offers free parking underneath the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel (service & location)”
Reviews.Author: Roro s
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel actually it was very nice hotel and clean,stuff was very helpful. the hotel is near to Emirates Mall really much better than expected i recomended for u to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad room service”
Reviews.Author: Marzouq
Reviews.Content: i call the reciprion asking for room service to bring ice to my room and they said we dont bring ice to your room , you have to go by your self and take it fron there kitchen .................................

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Junaid H
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and clean. Staff was very helpful and courteous. The rooms were cosy. We loved our view from the hotel room which was 11th floor. Being in close proximity to Mall of Emirates, it was the best place we could be. Everything was at an arms length to this place. Overall, i would say its an excellent hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “Cheap option”
Reviews.Author: SimonPitkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 2 nights, it's well located, cheap and modern. Room was unbelievably hot and was not sorted out so had two uncomfortable nights sleep, Breakfast was not great either and was a bit like slops. Plus side is it's location and value for money and has two quite good bars and plenty of free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: NeroNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: For my business trip, this hotel was just fine. Rooms are clean and modern. While there is no wifi in the room, the cable connection was good and speedy. Rooms weren't huge but were well designed, with a good sized safe for my computer and a small mini refrigerator. It was quiet and well located. The included breakfast was extensive and good, with many choices including western pancakes to Indian breakfast dal to mid-eastern treats, but the coffee was terrible. There is a pool on the roof, which I neither used nor saw and a decent fitness room, which I used every day and opened prompty at 6am. Price was great for what was provided, especially given that Dubai can be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: RasmusTT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights on our trip to Dubai. The location is perfekt, right next to the Mall of the Emirates and the Dubai Metro. Personal is extremly freindly and very helpful. The hotel is clean and tidy, we had no problems in any way during our stay. The hotel breakfeast could be better, but having the Mall of the Emirates right next door, there is only a very short walk to the Food Court there and several choices of food.

Reviews.Title: “good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: hafsa n
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean modern looks exactly as the photos shown and the staff were friendly too. This was me and my friends first trip to Dubai and found the location was excellent 5 min walk to the mall of emirates which has everything you need from food courts to exchange and all your fav high street shops however it was expensive. The rooms were clean but i had issue with the pillows they were awful i would recomment you pack your own if you dont like hard and big pillows as the hotel did not have any small fluffy pillows. The bathroom was clean and modern and the right size along withthe rooms. Housekeeping came to clean the room everyday we didnt need to run after them\. The rooftop pool was small but it wasnt busy and again looks exactly like it shows in the photo. Buffet breakfast was really good i never really had lunch or dinner at the hotel as we went across to the mall of emirates there also restaurants and takeways around the hotel from your italian, lebanese, indian etc. Taxis are available outside the hotel which was brilliant and they start their meters at 3dirhams which isnt bad and all good locations like burj al arab atalantis palm are 20 mins away in taxi so it can cost you about 50 dirhams or so. The staff were really helpful and i appraoched them at all times on advice on how to get around and they advised to catch the metro which is in the mall of emirates and costs 11 dirhams for day return and it got us to the burj khalifah and dubai mall. I would reccomend this Hotel to anyone whether old or young and i will definatley be staying there again if i go back to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Clean good Hotel. Will visit again !”
Reviews.Author: hpgore
Reviews.Content: Good Clean Hotel ! We (myself my wife and our baby) checked in at around 2:00pm and the check-in was fast and got a non smoking room. I had an envelope kept for me and they delivered it before even I asked them. Good impression ! Room: Clean neat room though not spacious rather it was small. Well appointed furniture with good colour combination. Bed size should have been broader. Bathroom too was clean and nice though small. TV: Not many channels just about 18 of them. There was no information on the telephone numbers of Reception, Housekeeping and others. Just the room-service number! I had to get these numbers from the room-service department. The House-keeping staff was very nice (Mr. Chandana) and was always on time when we wanted to get the room done. Appreciate this ! Pool on the rooftop is a small one and with attentive staff. Good view of Burj Khalifa and Burj al Arab and other skyline from here. Gym too is good. Buffet Breakfast: Good and balanced food variety. Would have been better if the menu saw changes. All the 5 days had almost the same menu. Just 2 dishes were different specifically the Indian dishes every day. I don’t know about lunch and dinner as I ate outside. Mall of the Emirates is very near (about 5 min from the parking space on the opposite side) and has a large food court. Citymax surroundings in Al Barsha have many restaurants of all types of cuisines. Taxi is easily available outside the Hotel and the Metro is available at the mall of Emirates although one needs to walk a lot to reach it; better to get a taxi and catch the metro at Sharaf DG. Overall Citymax is a good hotel and shall reserve room in this hotel the next time I visit Dubai. I stayed with my family for 5 days this November 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: burghead
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel many times with no problems at all. The rooms are always clean and functional, if all you want is a place to lay your head after a day shopping in the Mall of the Emirates then its ideal. If you are after a luxury hotel this clearly isn't it, but I have paid a lot more for "luxury classed" hotels and had worse service and dirty rooms. Cannot fault this hotel at all for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gwentherbert
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 6days in this hotel.Great price ,spotless, unbeatable value for breakfast .Staff were very friendly.( only 2disabled rooms ) but I coped ok. Shame pool is not sheltered at all as so hotand not enough beds but last week not surprising as fully booked !!!Would definetly recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, small room, staff needs to be courteous”
Reviews.Author: sdxt72
Reviews.Content: We got very frustrated at the time of check-in when the lady informed that they do not have any double-bed room but only separate beds. When we insisted multiple times, then she offered one on first floor, which we did not like, finally she asked the fellow person (mentioning my nationality) who keyed in some passwords on system and voila, the room was available. After that the lady informed us that if we plan to spend some money during our stay, better we prepay it now itself else later it will be time-consuming process (never heard such request before, it's not blocking the card, but pay)... The room was nicely decorated but very small (if one person moves, other has to stay at one place) and definitely not for family with kid(s). Other than these, hotel is new and nice. Cleaning staff is quite efficient and location is best, just next to major shopping mall. Also the free wired internet was quite helpful

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money 4+ UK standard”
Reviews.Author: SurreySunburnt
Reviews.Content: Iwas a bit dubious about staying here having read a couple of negative reviews. I really don’t understand why or how anyone could make them. The hotel was spotless our bed linen and towels chained daily all this in a 3 star hotel. The rooftop pool had fantastic views and clean modern showers fresh towels and a life guard. There is a sports bar and nightclub on the ground floor my only negative was that they were smoker friendly. We watched brilliantly executed Salsa that made strictly ballroom look amateur. Crossing two roads we were in The Emirates Mall with excellent shopping and fine restaurants St Mauritz and Après Ski on the top floor both serve alcohol The food was fresh, good value for money and the staff delightful. We stayed 10 days and will happily return

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: Svensk24
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are a bit small but everything u need is there. They have a great sports bar and a separate music room w a live band. Another restaurant and coffee shop thats 24hrs. Will stay again as u can't beat the location and friendly staff. I've been one month in the hotel for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rates”
Reviews.Author: cosmopolicious81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by our business partners on a work trip earlier this year. Rooms are small but clean, very affordable and most importantly the hotel is very conveniently located just across the Mall of the Emirates, where you will find all types of food. Unfortunately, advertised free internet did not function during my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “would avoid this hotel in the future should be on the banned list”
Reviews.Author: mig88
Reviews.Content: When you check in check in staff wants your credit card details and says for blocking the funds .Then you cart your luggage understandable its rated 3 star.You go for breakfast either you pay cash or deposit funds at the hotel even if it is 30AED not to say what they doing with your signed credit card copy - nothing is charged to your bill . Rooms ok but cleaning staff sometimes to forget put a bath mat sometimes fresh towel When you check out ,its not the price you checked in on but a higher rate , cant argue as business which made your reservation is shut and you bound to pay a higher rate . Hate it when hotel treats you like a thief - guess they are a thief so everybody is treated the same way .Never stay in this hotel again - Plus side nice bar Max but takes for ever to get an order

Reviews.Title: “nice location and good service.”
Reviews.Author: Daulet
Reviews.Content: My business meeting place was in Al-Barsha, so that was my primary reason for choosing this hotel. However later i found out that it is conveniently located, so i ca reach anywhere i want in Dubai. I liked the service, and i had no problem at all with it. I had no problem in checking in and checking out. The hotel was clean. I liked the pool on the roof. however, sometimes they did not have towels in the pool. The gym had necessary size to have full work out. If they make small curtain in the bath, that would be great since the floor in the bath was wet after the shower. I did not have breakfast/lunch/dinner in the hotel, but you can find all sorts of food and beverages in the near location and in MoE. The internet speed was good, please make sure that you get Ethernet cable. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “i like it.. that was my second time to stay at this hotel and surely will come next time too”
Reviews.Author: YoYoRiffa
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. It is nice to stay in this hotel for the price and the location. It is only a walking to distance to Emirates mall. Beside it many restaurants and massage places. If you live in this hotel you don't need to worry about food or supermarkets because all are there in walking distance. The breakfast buffet is good and cheap. I am sure i will stay in next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Shar T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April. Excellent hotel and extremely cheap! Spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Close to the Mall of the Emirates which was excellent. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Famil Stay @ CityMAX”
Reviews.Author: Suresh75
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and enjoyed the stay, clean, tidy rooms. Basic but well maintained GYM, Simple yet working Pool. But the parking lot could've been better. You should be a very good driver to park your car without scratching it's sides. Overall, a very reasonbly priced value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: zablob
Reviews.Content: Let face it, most people go to Dubai to shop. This hotel is located just a few steps away from the Mall of the Emirates. It provides a great place to shop till you drop. The best thing is that the room rates are extremely reasonable. So if you want to spend most of your funds on buying gifts and trinkets, this is the place to lay your head down at night. Even better, you won't need to rely on a taxi because everything is at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay !”
Reviews.Author: dgupta16
Reviews.Content: Good Neat Hotel. Courteous Personnel. Very Close to Emirates Mall. Good Breakfast Spread. Good Eating options all very near to Hotel. Superb Maxx Lounge for Music and Drinks. Though Far from the Airport; at first felt it but then afterwards it was great; after all eye view close to Emirates mall, Eatery options and Burj Al Arab. A Comfortable Stay !

Reviews.Title: “Below average Hotel;”
Reviews.Author: AbuLeen
Reviews.Content: Can't have control once it has lots of guests, we often suffered they delay getting our requested items. some walls needs paitings, they looked ugly with preveiously leaking water. this would be my first and last visit to this hotel. thanks.

Reviews.Title: “We were happy at first but got shocked”
Reviews.Author: KamalDarwish
Reviews.Content: Yes, we were happy my and my wife for getting "Shokran" loyality card discount offer . but got shocked with the size of the rooms which were very small. The reception staff are very rude and has no greeting talent and they are not allowed to smile during duty hours !!! we were told that they have free internet but it was very slow which makes you lose your temper and close your laptop. and they have no wireless only with cable. Their toilets having bad smell although it is clean. The daily room cleaning is only vacuuming and keeping things in place. They don't change the sheets although we stayed for a week. the surfaces were kept dusty. It has no cupboard the cloth hanger hold max four only. we were told that they have iron machine included. but it was not there. every time you ask for it they give it to you and take it back after room cleaning time. We said that we will try their restaurant for launch. Once we picked up the starter my wife discovered HAIR in the salad which they called the cook to do something about it. Checking out from the hotel. of course said HELLO with a smile but all I got angry faces with no reply !!!. They have no talent to say thank you for staying with us and come back again and whether I wanted help with taxi for the airport or not. she took the room card and said noting at all !!!! (by the way she was philipino lady). I was so embarrassed. They sent me an email when I arrived my country saying Thank you, come back gain. I say of course NO even if it is FREE

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Shaine69
Reviews.Content: Visited Dubai for the first time from Doha,Qatar during last year's Eid. The stay and the proximity to the Mall (MOE) was great. A good value for money. On a different note: The bathroom drain got clogged each time I ran the shower and even though the maintenance team tried fixing it, it failed. 3rd time was the charm. But Oh well, life ain't perfect...

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: TiChatte
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little small and there was no free wi-fi. U even had to pay for Internet at the business center. Didn't like this aspect of the hotel at all. Oh, also you had to bring all your toiletries, there was only a soap dispenser in the bathroom, which served as hand soap, shower gel, and shampoo. No lotion, no conditioner, no shower cap or vanity kit. So, as I mentioned before, it was very basic, okay...but don't expect any luxury here.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: sahmed729
Reviews.Content: This hotel really won us over. With great location and chic, modern decor throughout the hotel, it was definitely worth every penny. The hotel is located a quick 2 minute walk from the Mall of Emirates, which is great because the mall is also where you can connect to the Dubai metro. The room was small but we didn't feel cramped. The bathroom was decent sized but unfortunately there wasn't really a door or curtains for the shower, just a one foot wide window pane. After a shower the soap suds sort of rise up from the drain under the sink which was a bit weird. The staff was very helpful with everything we inquired about. On a Friday, Saturday night the lobby area can get a bit loud due to the Karaoke bar in the hotel but in our room we didn't hear a sound. The biggest draw back to this hotel was you had to pay for wireless internet. If you have your own ether-net cable then it was free in your room or else they were selling ether-net cable for ten dirhams. Overall the location and price make this an excellent hotel. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ,amazing staff but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cshellz2010
Reviews.Content: The overall stay has been pleasant . Staff was helpful esp.Adeel was really friendly .tried breakfast which was not very good and rather expensive for 40dhs per person .One could easily find several better options at MOE food court just across the street which also makes this hotel a perfect place to stay .there s a LuLu hypermarket at walking distance and Lots of shopping and great food nearby n the metro station also right at the mall which is easy access to a lot of places.taxis are also easy n affordable option in Dubai and available right outside the hotel .the guard at the hotel entrance was very helpful in finding us a big taxi so that our luggage would fit .Used the gym as well n was very impressed .everything was new and well maintained.the only complain is that the rooms are good for only two people and a small child would also not be able to sleep in these rooms which explains the non availability of extra beds.Internet is not free but that's true for most hotels in Dubai .there's a great sports lounge in the hotel with a big screen to watch matches and have a drink .

Reviews.Title: “grate”
Reviews.Author: lvutravel
Reviews.Content: small room size but clean ,very good location friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Treatment for a 3 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aziz_ZADA
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I've been almost to over 40 countries around the world and I have stayed in almost every luxury hotel. This was my first time to stay in a Budget hotel and specifically in Citymax Al-Barsha Hotel. It seriously surprised me with its amazing treatment and 5 star level staff. We were greeted on arrival with a very cheerful lady on the front desk that helped us check in. The hostess of the restaurant area is a very friendly and always smiling young lady. Seeing her each morning with her glowing smile is something you would look forward to. The breakfast was average, yet the service and the staff made the dining experience very special. We were offered water in our room only ONCE, which is a little disappointing. The lack of WiFi access in the rooms was also very inconvenient. We had to go down to the lobby every time we needed to send an email. The room was not cleaned unless we requested it cleaned by calling the room service. (yet when we did, a staff member would do it instantly) Citymax Hotel is one of the best hotels I've been to. I have been to some 5 star hotels which didn't offer as much as this hotel did and were not as professional and dedicated as this hotel's staff was. In addition to its amazing location, this hotel's Major's asset is its staff and professional treatment. I will most certainly be staying there in my future visits to Dubai and will be recommending it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel with professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus2007
Reviews.Content: It was very good experience to stay at Citymax hotel Al Barsha. Hotel staff at the reception desk greeted me warmly and with lots of smiles. They actually went out of their way to be helpful and all check in process was finished in 5 minutes. The room was very clean and well furnished and all amenities were new. As stated by other travelers the hotel is located across the street from Mall of the Emirates which enabled me to do my shopping conveniently. Finally, I would recommend this hotel for people who want to stay in a budget clean place near MOE.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great location !”
Reviews.Author: gymsusie3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Citymax Al Barsha for one week. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are comfortable and pleasant to stay in. The staff are very accommodating, although the driver of the free shuttle bus was very grumpy and you got the impression that it was a chore for him to be shuttling the guests around ! Other staff, however, went out of their way to be helpful which made up for the driver. The hotel was within a couple of minutes walk of the Mall of the Emirates where we managed to get some fresh fruit for breakfast every morning which only cost £1.50 for a punnet full (Carrefour) The metro link also runs through Mall of the Emirates and so it's equally as easy to get around using that. The hotel has a nice roof top pool and towels are provided free of charge and you can also hire towels to take to the beach (for a small fee & deposit) which saves having to pack them. There's also a gym which has everything you need for a workout - f you're that way inclined when you're on holiday ! All in all we enjoyed our stay here and we would definitely stay here again, it's great value for money and in a great location to get around and see the sights of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “pocket size rooms - immoral exchange rates”
Reviews.Author: jadedexpat
Reviews.Content: new and clean hotel. rooms are small though. rates are roughly on par with other hotels in dubai but would not be considered value for money in the real world. the hotel charged 20% commission on the exchange rate in april 2011, must be chinese owned.

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate, great for the price”
Reviews.Author: CY2
Reviews.Content: The Citymax is at a great location, close to the mall, beach and transit and for a great price. The hotel is clean, but is starting to show signs of ware, and has everything you need if you plan to stay a couple of nights. We stayed 10 nights and found it quite cramped for that long of a stay with our luggage, etc. Beware of the water pressure, it's great as long as no one else in the hotel is showering at the same time as you. The rooftop pool is nice when you don't have time to get to the beach but still want some fun.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place to stay, but no frills”
Reviews.Author: tollo652
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cheap and the rooms are clean and well furnished. You get what you pay for. The front desk staff are a mixed bunch, some very cheerful and helpful, others who just could not care less. Breakfast is not special, but at this price, you can't really complain. Use this place if you are on a budget, but otherwise there are much nicer options in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, everything else less than good...”
Reviews.Author: Mightyhim
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel knowing it was a budget style hotel but we were still disappointed. The rooms were very small, the bed was also small if fairly comfortable, the overall cleanliness of the hotel was poor- our bed sheets were not changed everyday and thr shower was underpowered and leaked over the bathroom floor. Other complaints were that there was complimentary water only for the first night and no free airport shuttle. Worst of all was house keeping cleaning rooms at midnight keeping us awake. On the plus it was great for getting to emirates mall almost opposite and bus shuttle to beach is very handy and decent location of beach. Would not book again, pay a bit more and stay somewhere a bit better if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean!”
Reviews.Author: wkspang
Reviews.Content: Citymax Al Barsha is a very clean above average budget hotel near the East Food Court of Mall of the Emirates. The bed was great. There was a desk, fridge, wardrobe and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was spotless though the shower water does splash out. There is also a gym and pool upstairs at the top! Annoyed that I had to pay a half day for arriving before check-in time and the hum of the air conditioning units outside. There is no free wifi, so best to go to a cafe on the left hand side of the building opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FMKhan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in newly developed area Al Barsha. Few hundreds of yards away from Mall of Emirates provides much flexibility to the tourists for meeting shopping, eating and daily needs. The hotel has a good bar with live music playing on friday/ saturday nights as experienced during my stay. The Sports Lounge was dull whereas lots of spors events around the world are usually held. However, they were not displayed. The reception is generally friendly but takes longer times to check in. Taxis are available on the door, which is a positive. Standard rooms (which we got at @ 300 DHS per night, incl taxes, without breakfast) are very small and cost higher than others of the same category in other places. Probably, it is due to the location and/ or on the weekend during DSF. Generally, a smart hotel to stay if u r not pushed for a luxury stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gopitsm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 8 days during December last week and it was very comfortable...the rooms are very clean and hygenic including the bathrooms..they clean it up regularly. The room size was quite small and there is not many TV channels (around 30 including the local channels) otherwise rest was all very good.The staff were courteous and friendly.The hotel has a bar which was quite active on weekends....the food variety was decent although expensive.... Overall its worth the money and you can stay their if you are planning to stay with your family....

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Louise150787
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Dubai, spent the first half of our trip at this hotel before staying near to the creek. This is a brand new hotel and is therefore spotlessly clean - we found the rates very good value especially as many of the hotels in Dubai are quite pricey. The rooms are exactly as shown on the hotel website photos - quite basic but very clean and we had a great view of both the Burj Al Arab and the Burj Khalifa. Great location - 2 minute walk to the Mall of the Emirates, 10 minutes to the nearest metro. Only slight negative would be the breakfast which was not very nice - better off going for the room only rate and just heading over to the mall for breakfast. We mainly used this hotel as a base for sightseeing so can't comment on many of the facilities/restaurants but would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in dubai”
Reviews.Author: dubai92
Reviews.Content: it was very good experience to stay at city max hotel albarsha. very near to mall of emirates,all types of food court available. metro station is also very near.rooms are clean & tidy. really good experience to stay at citymax albarsha. all sight seeing are located very near to hotel. i stayed for 6 nights & was very good experience. i recommend to everyone to stay in citymax albarsha

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a citytrip Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtraveller1980
Reviews.Content: The CityMax Al Barscha is a perfect hotel for a citytrip in Dubai. Next to Mall Of the Emirates where you can easily acces the metro (you don't have to get out of the Mall, just acces the metro on the second floor of the mall). You will be in Downtown Dubai (Burj Khalifa) by metro in 20 minutes for AED 4,50. To the Burj Al Arab by taxi will cost you 10 minutes and AED 15,-. Dubai Marina and Palm Jumeirah by taxi in 15 to 20 minutes for AED 20,-. We didn't spend much time in the hotel so I can't review the services of the hotel. We didn't have any problems with the staff or the hotel. We also used the swimmingpool on the rooftop where you also have a beautifull view over Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “not good experience”
Reviews.Author: doctorvoip
Reviews.Content: 1. Rooms were not ready for check in till 4.30 pm. 2. No porter availlable for luggage. 3. Room service very poor. 4. Reception never answer your call. 5. In standard Double room, the bed size was hardly enough to accomodate 2 guys. 6. very basic hotel NOT for Relaxation. 7. May be suitable for single person visiting business purpose. 8. Room size is small.

HotelInfo.Name: Citymax Al Barsha
HotelInfo.Address: Al Barsha Business District | behind Mall of Emirates, Dubai 337-1500, United Arab Emirates
